alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Morris; Titus (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 22 at 10:19PM CST until further notice by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... White Oak Creek Near Talco affecting Franklin, Titus and Morris Counties. .An active storm track will lead to several rounds of heavy rainfall through Wednesday night. Additional rainfall totals around 3 to 5 inches will be possible with locally higher amounts possible. For the White Oak Creek...including Talco...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White Oak Creek near Talco. * WHEN...From Tuesday evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding. Move livestock and equipment to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM CST Monday the stage was 6.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 16.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow evening and continue rising to a crest of 18.0 feet Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.0 feet on 03/31/1990. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Tuesday late morning.Tuesday evening at 1030 PM CST.
